plt.ylabel('Height',fontsize=16)

regression.fit(X, y)

plt.show()

source.ce787211: ## Weight as a Feature in the NBA
source.5d0842f9:
Basketball players tend to be tall, thin athletes because their height helps them to reach toward the basketball goal and defend the ball against opponents. Male professional basketball players tend to be about 9 inches taller than the average American male, according to NBA.com

Professional basketball players must be tall to be competitive in the league. In a survey of the average heights of professional basketball players in 2007 to 2008, the average height of a basketball player was 6 feet, 6.98 inches tall, according to NBA.com. The tallest basketball player was Yao Ming, who is 7 feet, 6 inches tall while the shortest basketball player was Nate Robinson, who is 5 feet, 9 inches tall. Considering that the average height of an American 25-year-old male is 5 feet, 10 inches tall, height is important in playing basketball

  • The average age of a drafted player is around 27 years.
  • The average height of a drafted player is 201.369 cms.
  • The average weight of drafted player is 101.374875 lbs.
  • The average number of games played by a player is around 59-60.
  • The average points scored by a player is 9.4 points per game.
  • The average rebounds scored by a player is 2.508336 per game.

## Predicting the Best Team in the NBA
Though we cannot exactly determine which team is going to win the NBA title this year. We can predict the team's performance based on previous stats available. Hence, we can predict the best team on the basis of points and rebounds per game
source.3b8b17b5:
From the plot below, we can understand the correlation between average points average scored per game and the rebounds per game.

We understand that a team can have varied points to rebound ratio. Some teams are better in terms of points scored, some are better at rebounds, however there are teams which have balanced playing style.
source.b96139ce: Sport performance is highly dependent on the health- and skill-related components of fitness (power, speed, agility, reaction time, balance, and Body Composition coordination) in addition to the athlete’s technique and level of competency in sport-specific motor skills. All fitness components depend on body composition to some extent. An increase in lean body mass contributes to strength and power development. Strength and power are related to muscle size. Thus, an increase in lean body mass enables the athlete to generate more force in a specific period of time. A sufficient level of lean body mass also contributes to speed, quickness, and agility performance (in the development of force applied to the ground for maximal acceleration and deceleration).

source.70c393e4:
### Change in number of players drafted each year NBA has seen a lot of changes over the years. Since its inception, the only constant in NBA has been 'change'. So, I will put forward some changes in form of statistical data.

The National Basketball Association is a professional basketball league in North America. The league is composed of 30 teams and is one of the four major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. It is the premier men's professional basketball league in the world. It had started in the year 1946, and has been continuing since then.
